timeline.message: better names for the upload warning dialog buttons #3494

timeline.bodyText: Are these in the wrong order? Upload should be on the right. If you could post a picture of the changes you made that would be very helpful
timeline.author: macgills
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -354,6 +354,8 @@ public void showDuplicatePicturePopup() {
                 String.format(Locale.getDefault(),
                         uploadTitleFormat,
                         uploadItem.getFileName()),
+                getString(R.string.cancel),

replies.bodyText: You'd think upload would be on the right, but it isn't. I've changed the description, and will post a picture later on when i get back to my laptop.
replies.author: hudlerr

replies.bodyText: @hudlerr You edited the title actually, the first comment on the PR is what I meant to say to edit
replies.author: macgills

replies.bodyText: Oops
replies.author: hudlerr

replies.bodyText: Thats the change - clicking on the 'UPLOAD IMAGE' button takes you to the second screenshot
replies.author: hudlerr

replies.bodyText: Just a thought: wouldn't "Upload" be sufficient for the button?
replies.author: sivaraam

replies.bodyText: Considering the description, shouldn't this be a simple Yes and No?
replies.author: ashishkumar468

replies.bodyText:
Also if we go with the material guidelines "Yes/No" are poor words to use, the action should be repeated in the positive button eg "Upload/Proceed" and the negative should be something like "Cancel" if you cancel an operation

That was the initial description of the issue i've gone by...
replies.author: hudlerr

replies.bodyText:
"Proceed" might be better, repeating the question phrase. Also "Warning" is not a great title, "Duplicate Image Found" would be better, maybe out of scope for this ticket about buttons.
Always give a good read of the guidelines
replies.author: macgills

replies.bodyText: Fair enough - I'll edit based on @macgills comment
replies.author: hudlerr

replies.bodyText: Edits! :)
replies.author: hudlerr

replies.bodyText: All that is left is to resolve the merge conflict so Proceed is on the right, we just merged a ticket to correct the order of buttons in dialogs.
replies.author: macgills

replies.bodyText: @hudlerr the positive and negative buttons are still in the wrong place
replies.author: macgills

replies.bodyText: Hi, could I get you guys' help on an error message that just makes the app crash? I haven't been able to work on anything because of it. My local copy is up to date with master and I haven't got any changes in it. (I've already posted on the mailing list)
replies.author: hudlerr

replies.bodyText: Have you done a full uninstall?
replies.author: macgills

replies.bodyText: I haven't, no.
replies.author: hudlerr

replies.bodyText: I meant of the app, not Android Studio etc. Best case for your sanity when this happens gradlew uA and File>Invalidate Caches/Restart and have a cuppa while the computer sorts itself out
replies.author: macgills

replies.bodyText: Goshh, its taken a lot longer than I thought. I've built and rebuilt and followed a bunch of answers on stack overflow, but it still crashes :(
replies.author: hudlerr

replies.bodyText:
I meant of the app, not Android Studio etc. Best case for your sanity when this happens gradlew uA and File>Invalidate Caches/Restart and have a cuppa while the computer sorts itself out

Have you done this? Re-importing the project can help sometimes.
If you are desperate delete your project, uninstall Android Studio. Reinstall, clone.
I just imported your project and ran the app.
replies.author: macgills

replies.bodyText: Yes, I did your first suggestion. And it worked for you? Im just gonna do the whole delete and reinstall thing at this point
replies.author: hudlerr

timeline.bodyText: I don't think "Duplicate Image Found" is an appropriate title for this dialog. This dialog is shown for other cases (take a look at the ImageUtils#getErrorMessageForResult method to get an idea). May be "Problems found in image" would be an appropriate title.
timeline.author: sivaraam

replies.bodyText: @macgills could I get a definitive answer on what to name these buttons please? I don't want to just keep committing...
replies.author: hudlerr

replies.bodyText:
it depends on the dialog for showDuplicatePicturePopup "Duplicate Image" makes sense, this is showBadImagePopup which has various pieces of text

@sivaraam is correct here
replies.author: macgills

replies.bodyText: My bad, I realised you guys meant I used the same title for both methods. All done now!
replies.author: hudlerr

timeline.bodyText: The question in this dialog would be "Do you still want to upload this picture?". So, using "Upload" would be more appropriate for the button.
timeline.author: sivaraam

timeline.bodyText: buttons are in wrong positions, Proceed on the right, Cancel on the left
timeline.author: macgills
